name: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company
description: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company, founded in 1898, is one of the world's largest tire manufacturers, known for its innovation in tire technology and commitment to quality. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, Goodyear operates globally, providing a wide range of tires for various vehicles, including passenger cars, trucks, buses, and specialty vehicles. The company is recognized for its advancements in tire design, including the development of the first tubeless tire and the introduction of the innovative Eagle and Assurance tire lines. Goodyear also has a strong focus on sustainability, investing in environmentally friendly practices and technologies, such as the use of renewable materials and recycling initiatives. In addition to manufacturing tires, Goodyear offers a variety of automotive services, including tire installation and maintenance. As a leader in the tire industry, Goodyear continues to strive for excellence through research and development, aiming to enhance performance, safety, and durability in its products. The company is committed to meeting the evolving needs of consumers while driving the future of mobility.

key_executives.name: Laura L. Thompson
key_executives.position: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer

seo.meta_title: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company | Leading Tire Manufacturer
seo.meta_description: Explore Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company, a global leader in tire manufacturing known for innovation and quality. Discover their wide range of products and commitment to sustainability.

faq.question: What types of tires does Goodyear produce?
faq.answer: Goodyear produces tires for passenger vehicles, commercial trucks, and specialty vehicles.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Goodyear?
faq.answer: Richard J. Kramer is the Chairman, CEO, and President of Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company.

faq.question: Where is Goodyear headquartered?
faq.answer: Goodyear is headquartered in Akron, Ohio, USA.

faq.question: What is Goodyear's commitment to sustainability?
faq.answer: Goodyear is committed to sustainability through the use of renewable materials and recycling initiatives in tire production.
